newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Sen. Lott hopes for action on budget.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Sen. Lott hopes for action on budget.

text.p: Senate Majority Leader Trent Lott said Monday he still hopes for bipartisan action on a balanced budget deal this year but said he has grown impatient with a lack of substantive negotiations with the White House.

Speaking on the Senate floor to outline the legislative plan for the coming weeks, the Mississippi Republican repeated his stance that his party must work with moderates among Clinton's own Democrats to reach a balanced budget.
Lott repeated his expectation that a White House meeting on the budget would not be held until next week or later.
